Krka

June 4, 2013 • Jack

We drove the boat up the Krka River to Skradin to take a look at the Krka National Park, one of the country’s Top 10 places, according to our guide book. We were not disappointed. On the way upriver, we stopped in Sibenik, a medium-sized city known for its cathedral and its old town, the only one in the country designed by Croats rather than Romans. The cathedral had some really cool carvings inside and out, including these faces paying homage to “common people” rather than saints.
